questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer is implementing a configuration checkpoint on a Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switch. The configuration must skip any existing vPC configuration errors and must complete if there are any configuration errors. The engineer finished the vPC domain configuration part. Which command completes the checkpoint implementation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
SP-03(config)# rollback running-config checkpoint zizu ?
*** No matching command found in current mode, matching in (exec) mode ***
 <CR> 
 atomic Stop rollback and revert to original configuration (default)
 best-effort Skip errors and proceed with rollback
 stop-at-first-failure Stop rollback at the first error
 verbose Show the execution log

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
Based on Guidelines the available options are :
1. atomic(default) Rollback only if there are no errors
2.Best-Effort: Rollback and skip any errors
3. Stop at First Failure : Rollback and stop if an error occurs
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/7-x/system_management/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_System_Management_Configuration_Guide_7x/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_System_Management_Configuration_Guide_7x_chapter_01000.pdf

Selected Answer: D
â€¢ Ingress replication is the only supported method for BUM forwarding
in the site external network. Multicast may be used in the internal site
in multisite but not in the site-external network for replication

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

questions.question_text: An engineer must implement a VXLAN-based data center interconnect. The long-distance transport provided by a service provider is IP-based, supports a maximum MTU of 1554 bytes, and does not support outbound traffic replication. Which action must be taken to build the data center interconnect?

choices.C: Configure a route map to associate the IPs of the remote VTEPs.
choices.B: Create an IP access list and associate it with VNI to replicate traffic to remote VTEPs.

questions.question_text: An engineer must perform an initial configuration of VXLAN Tunnel End-Point functionality on the Cisco Nexus 9000 Series platform. All the necessary features are already enabled on the switch. Which configuration set must be used to accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Which Is Better?
Option A might be preferred if you're leveraging VLANs for segmentation and want to utilize the logical interface (VLAN10) for VXLAN configuration.

Option D might be better if you prefer using a physical interface (Ethernet1/1) for VXLAN setup or if your deployment scenario does not involve VLANs.

I will go with D

Selected Answer: D
D but using the same loop back for underlay and overlay ?

Selected Answer: D
I am going to have to agree that it is "D" because i cannot find a single instance where the "Ip unnumbered looback" command is applied to an 'interface VLAN'. Poor logic and may not be accurate, but that is all i got. Definitely has to have the NVE interface configured, so can only be A or D. 

Creating and Configuring an NVE Interface and Associate VNIs

interface nve x
Creates a VXLAN overlay interface that terminates VXLAN tunnels
source-interface src-if
The source interface must be a loopback interface that is configured on the switch with a valid /32 IP address.
member vni vni
Associate VXLAN VNIs (Virtual Network Identifiers) with the NVE interface.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/93x/vxlan/configuration/guide/b-cisco-nexus-9000-series-nx-os-vxlan-configuration-guide-93x/b-cisco-nexus-9000-series-nx-os-vxlan-configuration-guide-93x_chapter_0100010.html#task_dnm_21b_zfb

I think the correct answer is A.
Even it creates NVE interface. In option D the interface eth1/1 is taking IP address from loopback 0 which is not right. It is done on the L3VNI configuration.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct! NVE creates a vtep switch

Selected Answer: D
D is correct as mauchi says
D is correct, bcs it's the only one which creates a NVE interface, which is the virtual interface in Nexus family which creates a VTEP (a vtep per vxlan)

choices.C: NX9K(config)# interface loopback0 NX9K(config-if)# ip address 10.10.10.11/32 NX9K(config)# interface tunnel1 NX9K(config-if)# tunnel source loopback0 NX9K(config)# interface ethernet1/1 NX9K(contig-if)# ip unnumbered loopback0
choices.A: NX9K(config)# interface loopback0 NX9K(config-if)# ip address 10.10.10.11/32 NX9K(config)# interface VLAN10 NX9K(config-if)# ip unnumbered loopback0 NX9K(config)# interface nve1 NX9K(contig-if-nve)# source-interface loopback0
choices.D: NX9K(config)# interface loopback0 NX9K(config-if)# ip address 10.10.10.11/32 NX9K(config)# interface nve1 NX9K(config-if-nve)# source-interface loopback0 NX9K(config)# interface ethernet1/1 NX9K(contig-if)# ip unnumbered loopback0
choices.B: NX9K(config)# interface loopback0 NX9K(config-if)# ip address 10.10.10.11/32 NX9K(config)# interface overlay0 NX9K(config-if-overlay)# source-interface loopback0 NX9K(config)# interface VLAN10 NX9K(contig-if-nve)# source-interface loopback0

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C, the solution is correct!

questions.question_text: An engineer must perform a software upgrade on a production Cisco Nexus 7000 Series Switch. Before the upgrade activity, the requirement is for all ports to be shut down and routing protocols to terminate gracefully. Which feature must be used to meet these requirements?
